en.emailConfirmation: Email confirmation has been sent to
en.yourResponse: Your response will be sent to the applicant. They can then apply for the court order which will divorce them and the respondent.
en.claimedCostsTitle: If the applicant has claimed their costs
en.claimedCostsText: The court will make a decision on this at the same time as it considers whether the divorce should be granted. You’ll be sent an email when the decision has been made, and the date of the hearing at which the cost order will be made.
en.objectingToCostsOrderText1: You can object to a costs order if you don’t think that you should pay it. You’ll need to email the court at least 14 days before the hearing, giving your reasons.
en.objectingToCostsOrderText2: You can contact the Courts and Tribunals Service Centre if you don’t hear anything back after 6 weeks.
en.ifYouNeedHelpText: You can contact the divorce centre if you need help. Court staff can’t give you legal advice however, and you should speak to a solicitor or legal adviser.
en.helpImproveText: Please help us improve this service by leaving your feedback.
en.divorceCenterHours:
Monday, Wednesday and Friday -phones are open 8am-6pm and Webchat open 8-8.
Tuesday and Thursday - Webchat and phones are open 8am-8pm.
Saturdays - Webchat and phones are open 8am-2pm.

en.whatYouNeedToDoNow: What you need to do now
en.submitAnswerToDivorce: You must now submit the 'answer to a divorce application' form. The deadline for the court to receive this is 21 days from the date you first signed in to respond to the divorce application.
en.fillInPaperForm: Download and fill in the paper form.
en.feeToPay: You’ll have to pay a £{{ feesDefendDivorce }} fee when you submit the form. If you have little or no savings, are on certain benefits or have a low income you may be able to get help with paying this fee.
en.hearingAboutDivorce: You may have to go to a hearing about the divorce.
en.dontSubmitAnswer: If you don’t submit your answer before the deadline, then the applicant can continue the divorce as if you hadn’t said that you intended to defend it.

cy.emailConfirmation: Mae neges e-bost yn cadarnhau ein bod wedi cael eich cais wedi’i anfon i
cy.yourResponse: Bydd eich ymateb yn cael ei anfon at y ceisydd. Yna, gall y ceisydd wneud cais am orchymyn llys i gael ysgariad oddi wrth yr atebydd.
cy.claimedCostsTitle: Os yw’r ceisydd wedi hawlio ei gostau
cy.claimedCostsText: Bydd y llys yn penderfynu ar hyn ar yr un pryd ag y bydd yn ystyried a ddylid caniatáu’r ysgariad. Wedi i’r llys benderfynu, anfonir e-bost atoch yn eich hysbysu o’r penderfyniad a dyddiad y gwrandawiad lle gwneir y gorchymyn costau.
cy.objectingToCostsOrderText1: Gallwch wrthwynebu gorchymyn costau os nad ydych yn meddwl y dylech ei dalu. Bydd angen ichi anfon e-bost i’r llys o leiaf 14 diwrnod cyn y gwrandawiad, gan roi eich rhesymau.
cy.objectingToCostsOrderText2: Gallwch gysylltu â Chanolfan Wasanaeth y Llysoedd a’r Tribiwnlysoedd os na fyddwch wedi clywed gennym ar ôl 6 wythnos.
cy.ifYouNeedHelpText: Os ydych angen cymorth, gallwch gysylltu â’r ganolfan ysgaru. Fodd bynnag, ni all staff y llys roi cyngor cyfreithiol ichi, a dylech siarad â chyfreithiwr neu gynghorydd cyfreithiol.
cy.helpImproveHeading: Helpwch ni i wella’r gwasanaeth hwn
cy.helpImproveText: Helpwch ni i wella’r gwasanaeth hwn drwy gynnig sylwadau.

cy.submitAnswerToDivorce: Yn awr rhaid ichi gyflwyno ffurflen 'ateb i gais am ysgariad'. Rhaid i’r llys dderbyn hon o fewn 21 diwrnod i’r dyddiad y gwnaethoch fewngofnodi gyntaf i ymateb i’r cais am ysgariad.
cy.fillInPaperForm: Llwytho ffurflen bapur i lawr a’i llenwi.
cy.feeToPay: Bydd rhaid i chi dalu ffi o £{{ feesDefendDivorce }} fee when you submit the form. If you have little or no savings, are on certain benefits or have a low income you may be able to cael cymorth i dalu’r ffi hon.
cy.hearingAboutDivorce: Efallai y bydd yn rhaid ichi fynd i wrandawiad ynglyn â’r ysgariad.
cy.dontSubmitAnswer: Os na fyddwch yn cyflwyno eich ateb mewn pryd, gall y ceisydd barhau gyda’r ysgariad fel pe baech heb ddweud eich bod yn bwriadu ei amddiffyn.
